summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL Supervisor Rounds log for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, covering rounds on August 9-10, 2019. It documents routine security checks, including checks of the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and a 'SUICIDE RM', in the days immediately preceding Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

events.title: Prison Supervisor Rounds
events.description: Multiple rounds of security checks conducted by lieutenants at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, throughout the day and evening.

events.title: Prison Supervisor Rounds
events.description: Multiple rounds of security checks conducted by lieutenants at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, throughout the morning, day, and evening.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (MCC New York)
keyFacts: The document is a prison supervisor's rounds log for August 9-10, 2019, the two days before Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell.
Rounds were conducted in key areas including the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and a room designated 'SUICIDE RM'.
The log shows consistent, routine checks by lieutenants across multiple shifts (Morning, Day, Evening watch).
The document is part of the post-mortem investigation into the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death.
No specific individuals are named in the log entries; all personnel are referred to by role (Lieutenant) and user/alpha codes.
